content.question: Decade Passengers 1950s 648 million 1960s 1.7 billion 1970s 5.4 billion UN International Civil Aviation Organization With the dawn of the Jet Age, international airline travel increased rapidly after 1950, and much of this early growth in jet travel was between Europe and North America. Which of the following best describes the spatial pattern suggested by the table?

choices.label: The volume of trade between Europe and North America increased.
The size of aircraft traveling between Europe and North America decreased.
The linear distance between Europe and North America decreased.
The absolute distance between Europe and North America increased.
The relative distance between Europe and North America decreased.

content.answer: The relative distance between Europe and North America decreased.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Describe spatial patterns presented in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data.
